author: samuraiturtle
title: The Monster Mash ...
review:
It is a grave yard smash.  It is the song that comes to mind when I think of this "Figure".   

Parts

What you see is what you get.  Legs, Torso, Head, Top of Head and a Guitar (not to mention the plate he stands on).  

The completed model

The guy is well printed.  For the legs it looks like he is wearing blue jeans and some "metal" shoes.  The guitar does have a bat printed on it (if you have not figured it out by now).  The head does have eyebrows printed on it if you do want to change his "hair" out for some thing else.  And for last the torso it is printed all over the front, back and the arms.  It is a "blue jean vest" with a black shirt underneath, on the back of the torso are the words "SHOCK 'n' ROCK" on what looks like some sort of patch.  

Overall opinion

This figure looks like it will be common enough, to find fairly easy.  And if you are like me and do not have a "Frankenstein Monster", he is a must get figure for your collection.  If you are using the feel method to find him I would feel for the "guitar" and / or "top of the head" (to locate him).

author: 8BrickMario
title: Revenant Rockin'!
review:
To be honest, I would have skipped this one if I didn't want the whole series. Is he any good?

Box/Instructions

The packaging is attractive and eye-catching. The contents are far more exciting.

Parts

The parts on this one are actually pretty good. The guitar is useful, and his forehead is a more realistic option for the Monster in the Monster Fighters theme. His outfit could also be reused. 

The build

Very very easy.

The completed model

I don't love the general idea, but there are some really nice touches. His arms are great, since they are dual-molded and printed! The black sleeves have a bit of printed tattering, and both of his wrists are stitched up. On the back of his denim vest, it says "Shock 'N Roll", which is amusing. His guitar is slightly spooky with the bat-wing design. His face is a bit cheesy, but this minifigure is not meant to be used in scary scenes.

Overall opinion

He's okay. He's still at the bottom of my list, but I don't have any complaints other than the fact that he doesn't interest me. I imagine a lot of people will be skipping him, but if you want him, go for it.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Rrrgahhhh!
review:
Set #71010 Monster Rocker: Rock out loud with Frankenstein's Monster dressed up in a rock band costume. That's basically what this Minifigure represents and he looks pure awesome.

His torso features dual-molded arms with some great subtle printing that hides this fact. His front is printed with a padlock on a chain over his t-shirt while on the back you have the band name Shock 'n' Roll. His legs feature some great blue-jean print with steel toed shoes and his face has a very suitable looking expression for a rock 'n' roll guitar player.

His guitar accessory has a nice printed bat detail on it and he definitely stands out as one of the better ones from the series. I'd definitely recommend tracking him down if you missed out on him, multiples would be nice too for MOC figs to add to his band.
